abstract: The words of Peter Drucker, the sociologist, management thinker and best-selling author, who died at age 95 in 2005, still resonate with anyone in technology. His thinking about the new networked era offers insights into the changing way we work. Business schools, heavy with math and economics majors, may not be recruiting the right kind of people to learn how to run this kind of workplace.
lead_paragraph: The business world is embracing social networks, both as work enablers and as products. Sites like LinkedIn keep people up on job opportunities, while professional "friends" on Facebook can keep us abreast of advances in our fields.

headline.main: A Prophet for a New Workplace
